verb.description: To twist, wind, or spin (threads, fibres, wires, etc.) into cord, braid, net, etc.
To whirl; to revolve rapidly, spin.
To cause to revolve, to spin, roll; to throw or toss with spinning motion.

origin: Early 16th century; earliest use found in John Skelton (c1460–1529), poet. Origin uncertain; perhaps ultimately showing two or more words of separate origin; perhaps (partly) imitative. Attested earliest in pirling, which in its earliest sense apparently shows sense 3a. With sense 1 compare purl, purl, which apparently show senses developed ultimately from this word.
